page.title: 01INTERESTING ASPECTS OF AREA
page.content: TOURISM THRIVES BECAUSE EARL SPENCER OWNS MUCH OF THIS LAND. HOLDENBY IS THE NOTABLE EXCEPTION.THE GENERAL LANDSCAPE IS SOFTLY UNDULATING WITH MANY TREES ADDING INTEREST TO THE VIEW. FROM SPRATTON,PERCHED ON THE HILL CREST ONE MAY LOOK ACROSS TO SEE BRIXWORTH AND CHAPEL BRAMPTON. THE ELIZABETHAN PALACE AT HOLDENBY WAS ORIGINALLY EIGHT TIMES ITS PRESENT SIZE WHEN BUILT BY SIR CHRISTOPHER HATTON,LORD CHANCELLOR TO ELIZABETH I, AS THE LARGEST HOUSE OF ITS AGE. THE SURROUNDING HAMLET OF HOLDENBY IS VERY UNSPOILT AND A DELIGHT TO THE EYE. SPRATTON HAS MANY OLD HOUSES BUILT FROM LOVELY WARM LOCAL STONE BUT THE VILLAGE IS LESS ATTRACTIVE BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF CONTEMPORARY BUILDING. THE OLD PART OF THE VILLAGE IS SITED JUST BELOW THE CREST OF THE HILL AND THE MODERN DEVELOPMENT SURROUNDS IT.
